paper_keywords: Fault tolerant control systems with Markovian parameters (FTCSMP)
paper_abstract: A bilinear discrete time fault tolerant control system (DTFTCS) corrupted by additive and multiplicative noises and disturbances is modelled in this article. Multiplicative noises are assumed to be linearly dependent of the state and control input Of the DTFTCS. Second moment stochastic stability for the proposed bilinear DTFTCS actuated by a state feedback control law) with constant gains is characterized. Necessary and sufficient conditions are derived in terms of nonlinear matrix inequalities. Sufficient conditions for the existence of a stabilizing controller that guarantee second moment stability and 6-level of disturbance rejection are derived. The conditions are stated in terms of feasibility solutions for a set of linear matrix, inequalities (LMI). An M-driven stabilizing controller is synthesized.
paper_title: BILINEAR DISCRETE FAULT TOLERANT CONTROL SYSTEMS: CONTROLLER DESIGN
